Title: 2018 state of fisheries and aquaculture
Summary: The State of World Fisheries and Aquaculture 2018 presents FAO’s official world fishery and aquaculture statistics.

Title: A Brief Introduction and Applications of Blue Biotechnology
Summary: A brief introduction and applications of blue biotechnology\ the application of molecular biological methods to marine and freshwater organisms.

Title: An overview of marine renewable energy
Summary: For countries and territories that have extensive maritime areas\ renewable marine energy can make a significant contribution to low-carbon electricity production in the energy mix. This briefing provides an overview of the sector

Title: Aquaculture & Sustainability
Summary: Fish and shellfish farming are facing a new era of expansion in Europe. What are the environmental implications of this\ and how can the sector expand sustainably? Watch the video produced by Science for Environment Policy about how aquaculture could develop in greater harmony with environmental goals.

Title: Best management practices for marine cage culture operations in the U.S. Caribbean
Summary: This document sets out guidelines for stakeholders committed to sustainable marine aquaculture which safeguards the ocean

Summary: This fourth volume in the Commonwealth Blue Economy series aims to support the development of the blue economy by providing a high level assessment of the opportunities available for economic diversification through the development of a blue biotechnology sector in SIDS and by examining relevant examples from around the world.

Summary: Report from the World Bank setting out a framework for the development of a Blue Economy

Summary: The Coastal Aquaculture Planning Portal (CAPP) is a toolbox of coastal planning tools designed to assist managers\ planners\ and industry with sustainable aquaculture development.

Summary: A brief from the Integrated Climate Change Adaptation Strategies (ICCAS) Programme on Coastal Zone Management in Grenada\ Carriacou and Petite Martinique

Title: Commonwealth Marine Economies Programme Dominica Country Review
Summary: A country review for Dominica that highlights opportunities where the UK can apply and leverage its world-leading expertise to make significant\ cost-effective and lasting positive impacts in relation to the marine economy.

Title: Commonwealth Marine Economies Programme Grenada Country Review
Summary: A country review for Grenada that highlights opportunities where the UK can apply and leverage its world-leading expertise to make significant\ cost-effective and lasting positive impacts in relation to the marine economy.

Title: Commonwealth Marine Economies Programme St Vincent and the Grenadines Country Review
Summary: A country review for St Vincent and the Grenadines that highlights opportunities where the UK can apply and leverage its world-leading expertise to make significant\ cost-effective and lasting positive impacts in relation to the marine economy.

Title: Deep sea mining briefing
Summary: A brief on deep sea mining covering what is the issue; why is it important; and what can be done?

Title: Deep sea mining could transform the globe
Summary: An overview of the opportunities and potential threats posed by the deep sea mining industry

Title: Deep sea mining: new depths
Summary: In 2019\ the world’s first commercial deep-sea mine is due to open. But are regulations in place to protect the sea floor?

Title: Deep sea wonders of the Caribbean - an ocean of opportunity
Summary: Deep Sea Wonders of the Caribbean is a five-part video series that promotes awareness of the Caribbean’s deep oceans. This episode looks at careers within the deep ocean.

Title: Ecological aspects of deep sea mining
Summary: The MiningImpact project gathers 32 partners from 10 different countries and conducts an independent scientific monitoring of the impact of an industrial test to harvest manganese nodules in the Clarion Clipperton Zone.

Title: EU Blue Economy Report 2019
Summary: This report published by the European Commission describes the scope and size of the EU blue economy. It provides an overview of the most recent trends in several socioeconomic indicators and analyses the drivers behind such trends. The aim is to support policymakers and stakeholders in the quest for a sustainable development of oceans\ sea and coastal resources.

Title: FAO Policy Series: Blue Growth Initiative
Summary: Pollution\ illegal fishing\ over-exploitation and climate change have become major threats to aquatic eco-systems. We need to change how the planet's marine and freshwater resources are managed. The FAO explain how the Blue Growth Initiative contributes to balancing food security\ economic growth\ social development and the sustainable use of aquatic living resources.

Title: Financing the Blue Economy: A Caribbean Development Opportunity
Summary: This report examines the potential of the blue economy to drive sustained and inclusive economic growth. It also explores factors that can constrain the Caribbean’s ability to take full advantage of the ocean’s potential.

Title: Fisheries governance fact sheets
Summary: Fact sheets from the FAO on each of the Regional Fisheries Bodies setting out their objectives; area of competence; species and stocks coverage; and members

Summary: Fact sheets from the FAO on typical fishing equipment

Title: Fishing gear fact sheets
Summary: Fact sheets from the FAO on typical fishing gear

Summary: Fact sheets from the FAO on typical fishing techniques

Summary: Fact sheets from the FAO on typical fishing vessels

Summary: Fact sheets from the FAO on typical fishing vessel monitoring systems

Title: Guidance on spatial technologies for disaster risk management in aquaculture
Summary: This guide describes the application of spatial technology to improve disaster risk management (DRM) within the aquaculture sector.

Title: How offshore wind farms work
Summary: Offshore windfarms are the future of energy. Ever wondered how they work?

Title: How to build the worlds largest offshore wind farm
Summary: Britain's east coast will soon house the world's largest offshore wind farm in a major step forward for renewable energy generation.

Title: Integrated Coastal Zone Management Policy for Grenada\ Carriacou and Petite Martinique
Summary: The ICZM Policy presented here is an effort towards furnishing Grenada with the necessary guidelines\ principles\ and tools to effectively manage the activities in its coastal zone whilst providing an environment through which the understanding and appreciation of the importance of coastal resources is strengthened.

Title: JPI Oceans: Ecological Aspects of Deep-Sea Mining
Summary: In 1989 German ocean researchers started a unique long-term experiment off the coast of Peru. To explore the effects of potential deep sea mining on the seabed\ they plowed in about eleven square kilometer area around the seabed\ this video shows the results of that experiment.

Title: Marine biotechnology
Summary: Pocket guide to marine biotechnology

Title: Marine biotechnology
Summary: Biotechnology researchers are currently exploring the secrets of marine life in hopes of learning more about the genetics of viruses\ how to utilize chemicals unique to marine species to help fight cancer\ and even replicate the bacteria found naturally in marine environments to help break down metal pollutants

Title: Marine Biotechnology: A New Vision and Strategy for Europe
Summary: This report was initiated by the European Marine Board to provide an updated view of Marine Biotechnology to policy makers at EU and national levels and to EU and national scientific and administrative officers involved in research in marine sciences and their interacting fields in health\ food\ environment and energy.

Title: Marine Fisheries
Summary: Global ocean data and trends for informed action and decision-making on marine fisheries

Title: Marine Renewable Energy
Summary: This fourth volume in the Commonwealth Blue Economy series aims to support the development of the blue economy by providing a high level assessment of the opportunities available review of actions needed to progress marine renewable energy generation in SIDS.

Title: Marine renewable Energy
Summary: An animation focusing on the challenges linked to the use of marine renewable energies.

Title: Marine Renewable Energy Powering the Blue Economy
Summary: Marine renewable energy – energy from waves\ currents\ and tides – has the potential to provide a locally sourced\ emissions free\ reliable form of power where electricity could otherwise not be generated. This video provides an overview of the work being done to advance cutting edge technology in this sector

Title: Microbiome Research Will Accelerate The Blue Biotechnology Industry
Summary: Humans have relied on the ocean for millennia as a source of food and materials for tools. Now\ we rely on the ocean as a source of genes that we can harness to increase food stocks and use as medicine for cancer and other diseases.

Title: Monaco Blue Initiative 2018 Towards Blue Economy
Summary: With a focus on the North Sea and Arctic regions\ this panel examined the challenges of ensuring Blue Growth was conducted responsibly\ and explored the tools in place or in development to assist with this process.

Title: Ocean Economy in 2030
Summary: This report explores the growth prospects for the ocean economy\ its capacity for future employment creation and innovation\ and its role in addressing global challenges. Special attention is devoted to the emerging ocean-based industries in light of their high growth and innovation potential\ and contribution to addressing challenges such as energy security\ environment\ climate change and food security.

Title: OECS Caribbean Regional Oceanscape Project
Summary: What is C.R.O.P. ? The initiatives of the project\ the time frame of the C.R.O.P and the countries that will be affected the C.R.O.P.

Title: Offshore Energy
Summary: Secure energy is an essential building block for social development. But sustainable development needs sustainable energy sources. Developing exciting renewable energy technologies is therefore a key part of Europe’s plan to build a healthy future

Title: Principles for a sustainable Blue Economy
Summary: WWF releases a brief on ‘Principles for a Sustainable Blue Economy’ to clarify the increasingly popular concept—and to emphasize that it’s not about simply exploiting our oceans

Title: Reef Fisheries
Summary: The Coral Reef Fisheries Module covers key topics including coral reef fisheries stock assessment methods\ tools for managing fisheries\ and surveillance and enforcement systems.

Title: Sand and Sustainability: Finding new solutions for environmental governance of global sand resources
Summary: This report looks at potential solutions for mitigating mineral sands and aggregates extraction impacts and generating adequate support for responsible consumption pathways.

Title: Study on the potential of fish farming in the Caribbean
Summary: This study covers the signficance of fish farming in the Caribbean and looks to address key issues around the sustainability of the sector for the future

Title: Submarine Cable Installation: Tools for Power\ Telecom\ and Seismic Cables
Summary: Submarine cable installations in the telecom\ power and seismic industries have similarities and differences. But there is a common thread in every submarine cable lay: you need accurate real-time control over the position and bottom tension of your cable as it lands on the seabed. This video discusses a proven method for achieving this control being used by over 75% of the telecom cable ships in the world.

Title: Submarine Cable Map
Summary: Interactive map of all submarine cables around the globe

Title: The Aquaculture Opportunity
Summary: Can the aquaculture sector grow to provide seafood and jobs in harmony with the ocean?

Title: The Blue Economy and Small States
Summary: This Commonwealth Blue Economy Series presents a synthesis of information and practical advice to Commonwealth governments relating to the potential deployment of a range of policy options for different sectors and opportunities for the road ahead. In so doing\ this series aims to support the development of the blue economy in Commonwealth countries by providing a high-level assessment of the opportunities available for economic diversification and sustainable growth.

Title: The Blue Economy: From Concept to Reality in the Caribbean Region
Summary: This paper provides an overview of the opportunities presented by the blue economy\ providing the basis for discussion of some practical measures that Caribbean countries and the region as a whole can take to realise those opportunities; and offering some suggestions for DWG engagement in promoting these national and regional efforts to build an effective and sustainable Caribbean blue economy

Title: The Caribbean Blue Economy
Summary: What is the Blue Economy? Its benefits\ it's impacts and the relation to OECS Caribbean Region in transitioning to a Blue Economy.

Title: The case for fish farming
Summary: We're headed towards a global food crisis: Nearly 3 billion people depend on the ocean for food\ and at our current rate we already take more fish from the ocean than it can naturally replace. The solution is aquaculture\ or fish farming.

Title: The Potential of the Blue Economy : Increasing Long-term Benefits of the Sustainable Use of Marine Resources for Small Island Developing States and Coastal Least Developed Countries
Summary: This report was drafted by the United Nations\ the World Bank\ and other stakeholders to suggest a common understanding of the blue economy; to highlight the importance of such an approach\ particularly for small island developing states and coastal least developed countries; to identify some of the key challenges its adoption poses; and to suggest some broad next steps that are called for in order to ensure its implementation.

Title: The State of World Fisheries and Aquaculture 2018
Summary: The State of World Fisheries and Aquaculture aims to provide objective\ reliable and up-to-date information to a wide audience\ including policy-makers\ managers\ scientists\ stakeholders and indeed all those interested in the fisheries and aquaculture sector. The 2018 edition of The State of World Fisheries and Aquaculture emphasizes the sector’s role in achieving the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development and the Sustainable Development Goals\ and measurement of progress towards these goals.

Title: The Sustainable Blue Economy
Summary: The Ocean is the blue heart of our planet … How can we foster Blue Growth in a smart\ sustainable and inclusive way?

Title: Tidal energy
Summary: Tidal energy is a renewable energy powered by the natural rise and fall of ocean tides and currents. Some of these technologies include turbines and paddles.

Title: Tidal power 101
Summary: Tidal power converts the energy from the natural rise and fall of the tides into electricity.

Title: Transitioning Toward a Blue Economy in Grenada and Other Eastern Caribbean States
Summary: The blue economy\  has provided a means of addressing the Eastern Caribbean region’s poverty and unemployment challenges through sustainable financing mechanisms and enhanced capacity for effective management and protection of the environmental base needed for future economic growth.

Title: Wave energy\ harnessing the oceans power
Summary: Harnessing energy from the waves of the world's oceans seems like the ultimate in renewable fuel.  Yet research lags 15-20 years behind studies of solar and wind power.

Title: What is aquaculture?
Summary: What is aquaculture? Here's an overview in under two minutes.

Title: What is marine biotechnology
Summary: Marine biotechnology\ sometimes referred to as “blue biotechnology”\ exploits the diversity found in marine environments in terms of the form\ structure\ physiology and chemistry of marine organisms\ many of which have no  equivalenton land\ in ways which enable new materials to be realised.

Title: Why can't we get power from waves?
Summary: Wave power hasn’t yet made a splash because it’s hard to use waves to spin turbines\ and because the sea is a harsh place to build things.

Title: Why The Blue Economy Matters
Summary: What's the state of the ocean? How big is the #BlueEconomy? What can be done to fix the #oceans #plastic issue? Some of our experts have discussed it at the Impact Roundtable on #MarineConservation.

Title: World Ocean Summit 2017 Financing the Ocean Economy
Summary: The fourth World Ocean Summit was held in Bali\ Indonesia\ on February 22nd-24th 2017 and brought a critical eye to the vital issue of how to finance a sustainable ocean economy.

Title: World’s Largest Open-Ocean Fish Farm
Summary: Located off the coast of Panama\ the world’s largest open-ocean fish farm raises hundreds of thousands of cobia fish in colossal underwater pods.

Title: Ascension\ an ocean of life
Summary: A look under the waters off Ascension Island

Title: Callum Roberts Explains The Importance Of Marine Protected Areas
Summary: Back in the 1880s\ UK Fishermen caught 17 times more fish than they do today. We have depleted our coastal seas’ fish populations\ but how can we change this? The University of York’s Professor Callum Roberts explains why marine recovery around our coastlines is possible and how marine protected areas could see our seas leaping with life once again.

Title: CaMPAM
Summary: CaMPAM is an an inclusive network to exchange ideas and lessons learned regarding the delivery of the Caribbean Challenge. a large-scale initiative advocated by a number of governments and regional and international organizations which aims to protect 20% of the marine and coastal habitats of Caribbean countries associated with the initiative by 2020

Title: Caribbean Challenge Initiative
Summary: The Caribbean Challenge Initiative (CCI) is a coalition of governments \ companies and partners working together to accelerate action on the marine and coastal environment

Title: Caribbean Ocean Conservation
Summary: An overview of the work undertaken by the Pew Foundation to support sustainable fishing\ ocean habitat conservation\ and other measures that protect vital marine resources in the U.S. Caribbean.

Title: Climate resilient Eastern Caribbean Marine Managed Areas Network
Summary: The Eastern Caribbean Marine Managed Areas (ECMMAN) project ran from 2013 – 2017 and invested over EC$14.7 million\ to improve fisheries and conserve and restore marine resources\ while providing for sustainable job opportunities in coastal communities.

Title: Create a Marine Protected Area
Summary: Students brainstorm and analyze competing ocean resources and uses. They experiment with designating a marine protected area along an imaginary coastline and discuss the challenges of deciding on rules and restrictions within it.

Title: Dominica Coral Reef Report Card
Summary: The Eastern Caribbean Coral Reef Report Cards are a series of individual reports for the 6 participating countries and provide an easy-to-understand summary of the state of the region’s marine resources.

Title: Dominica’s Sea Turtle Conservation Organization
Summary: Dominica’s Sea Turtle Conservation Organization Inc. (DomSeTCO) was founded in 2007 to coordinate a national sea turtle research\ conservation and ecotourism effort in the Commonwealth of Dominica.

Title: Glimpses of a pristine ocean
Summary: Enric Sala shares glorious images -- and surprising insights and data -- from some of the most pristine areas of the ocean. He shows how we can restore more of our oceans to this healthy\ balanced state\ and the powerful ecological and economic benefits of doing so

Title: In Belize\ local stewardship key to marine conservation
Summary: Local communities in Belize are at the forefront of marine resources management and their engagement in conservation and shared governance is crucial to ensuring sustainable use of ocean resources

Title: Interview with a Caribbean marine conservation champion
Summary: Dr Georgina Bustamante\ Coordinator of the Caribbean Marine Protected Areas Management Network and Forum (CaMPAM)\ shares some thoughts on the collaboration with the BIOPAMA programme and the potential of further engagement for biodiversity conservation in the Caribbean region

Title: IUCN Global Standard for MPAs
Summary: The IUCN Global Standard for Marine Protected Areas (MPAs) is a synthesis of the existing IUCN Green List Standard for Protected and Conserved Areas

Title: Kelp forests
Summary: Off the coast of southern California\ Catalina Island is known as one the greatest places in the world to see Kelp Forests.  Jonathan travels to Catalina Island to explore these fantastic undersea forests of plants and meets the animals that live there\ including a Torpedo ray that attacks his camera!

Title: Lyme Bay Case Study
Summary: Restricting the amount of inshore potting for crab and lobster within marine protected areas (MPAs) can generate a “win-win” for both fishermen and the marine environment\ according to the first major study exploring the issue.

Title: Mangrove mystery
Summary: Plum's latest mission? Find a "sea cow!"   thanks to UBT - underwater bubble technology - Gabi\ Oliver and Brad are able to travel deep inside a mangrove swamp ... where they discover all kinds of interesting creatures!

Title: Marine Protected Areas in Saint Lucia
Summary: a list of marine reserves\ comprising coral and artificial reef areas\ beaches and mangroves as last declared in 2000 under the Fisheries Act No. 10 of 1984.

Title: Marine Protected Areas in the Eastern Caribbean\ a tourism market study
Summary: This report summarizes the results of the tourism market survey of marine protected areas (MPAs) conducted in the Eastern Caribbean and offers recommedation on how to better manage and market MPAs within the Easten Caribbean for tourism.

Title: Mission Blue
Summary: Mission Blue inspires action to explore and protect the ocean. Led by legendary oceanographer Dr. Sylvia Earle\ Mission Blue is uniting a global coalition to inspire an upwelling of public awareness\ access and support for a worldwide network of marine protected areas – Hope Spots.

Title: MPA Atlas
Summary: MPAtlas.org\ a project of the Marine Conservation Institute\ was launched in 2012 as a way to provide a more nuanced picture of global marine protection. Our goal is to clarify and visualize the level of protection and implementation of the world's MPAs

Title: Patagonia projects - Whale conservation
Summary: This video shows efforts to further whale conservation in the remote windswept archipelagos of Patagonia

Title: Pristine seas
Summary: National Geographic Explorer-in-Residence Enric Sala launched the Pristine Seas project in 2008 to explore and help protect the last wild places in the ocean

Title: Protected Areas in the wider Caribbean region
Summary: An overview of protected areas in the wider Caribbean region

Title: Protecting Grenada's Marine Life
Summary: From their earliest memories\ Cecil McQueen and Coddington Jeffery have always loved the water. One a fisherman\ the other a scuba diver\ they both have spent their childhood and adult lives on the Eastern Caribbean island of Grenada. McQueen and Jeffery are the first two wardens of the Molinière-Beauséjour Marine Protected Area (MPA) along the southern coast of Grenada.

Title: Saint Lucia National Conservation Fund
Summary: Incorporated in 2016\ the Saint Lucia National Conservation Fund (SLUNCF) is dedicated to the conservation\ restoration\ and effective management of Saint Lucia’s biodiversity and natural resources.

Title: Sandy Island/Oyster Bed Marine Protected Area Moorings Restoration Project
Summary: We visited the Sandy Island/Oyster Bed Marine Protected Area to document the installation of new moorings funded by a grant from UKAID & implemented by CARIBSAVE and the Caribbean Community Climate Change Centre (5Cs)\ as part of the Caribbean Fish Sanctuary Partnership Initiative (C-FISH) Initiative.

Title: Sharks
Summary: Fearsome or Fascinating? Are sharks really the man eating monsters we make them out be\ or are they simply misunderstood?

Title: Soufriere Marine Management Areas
Summary: The Soufriere Marine Management Association Inc. is a self-sustained not-for-profit NGO authorized by the Government of St. Lucia to manage both Soufriere Marine Management Area (SMMA) and the Canaries & Anse La Raye Marine Management Area (CAMMA).

Title: St Vincent and the Grenadines Environment Fund
Summary: The St. Vincent and the Grenadines Environment Fund is a non-profit company registered in St. Vincent and the Grenadines to support sustainable initiatives to promote the preservation of the beauty and natural value of the islands.

Title: St. Kitts Sea Turtle Monitoring Network
Summary: The St. Kitts Sea Turtle Monitoring Network (SKSTMN) is a community based nonprofit organization founded in January 2003 which monitors nesting sea turtle populations & acts as an advocate for the strengthening of sea turtle protection laws.

Title: The brilliance of bioluminescence
Summary: Some lucky animals are naturally endowed with bioluminescence\ or the ability to create light. The firefly\ the anglerfish\ and a few more surprising creatures use this ability in many ways\ including survival\ hunting\ and mating. Leslie Kenna investigates this magical glow - and our quest to replicate it.

Title: The importance of kelp
Summary: Eminent marine biologist Jane Watson eloquently explains just why kelp is so important to so many species.

Title: The intertidal
Summary: One of the most difficult habitats for any organism to inhabit is the intertidal. Wave energy\ temperature fluctuations\ and salinity changes make living here impossible for all but a few of the hardiest plants and animals. We sneak into this mostly unexplored habitat during the short window of time when the tide is out and the tidepools are accessible.

Title: The kelp forest ecosystem
Summary: Otters\ Kelp and How We're All Connected: What happens when we save one species over another?

Title: The Narrows\ St Kitts and Nevis
Summary: the Narrows is the name of the strait that separates the Caribbean Islands of St. Kitts and Nevis. This will be the first protected area within the Marine Managed Area.

Title: The remarkable biodiversity of UK Overseas Territories
Summary: This video shows the remarkable range of biodiversity across the UK overseas territories

Title: Turneffe Atoll\ Belize's Jewel in the Crown
Summary: In 2012 Turneffe Atoll was declared a Marine Reserve thanks to an important commitment from the Bertarelli Foundation\ protecting a wealth of marine life and helping to secure the future of local small-scale fisheries.

Title: What are Marine Protected Areas?
Summary: What are Marine Protected Areas\ and what do they actually do? Learn more in our latest video.

Title: What is a marine protected area?
Summary: Learn more about how marine protected areas conserve\ manage\ and protect.

Title: A day in the life of an Ocean Exploration ROV pilot
Summary: A Peek into the Life of a Global Foundation for Ocean Exploration ROV Pilot

Title: Atlantic Ocean Research Alliance\ The Last Great Exploration Campaign on Earth
Summary: The challenge of keeping our ocean healthy is too great for any one nation to tackle alone. Together\ we are building an Atlantic community of researchers\ policymakers\ businesses and citizens. This Atlantic Community extends across and along the Atlantic Ocean. AORA facilitates common research and knowledge exchange for us to provide healthy\ resilient oceans for our future generations.

Title: Caribbean Marine Atlas
Summary: The Caribbean Marine Atlas (CMA) is an online digital platform that stores and provides access to geospatial information (and related documents) on the "Marine Environment and Human Societies in the Wider Caribbean Region".

Title: Everything you need to know about drifter buoys
Summary: The Volvo Ocean Race teams aren't just racing around the planet – they're making a key contribution to ocean science

Title: Exploring the oceans
Summary: Ocean explorer Robert Ballard takes us on a mindbending trip to hidden worlds underwater\ where he and other researchers are finding unexpected life\ resources\ and even new mountains. He makes a case for serious exploration and mapping.

Title: Finding Fish Hotspots and Mapping Coral Reefs
Summary: Expedition Marks Twelve Years of Discovery in the Caribbean

Title: General Bathymetric Chart of the Oceans
Summary: GEBCO aims to provide the most authoritative\ publicly available bathymetry data sets for the world’s oceans

Title: General Bathymetric Chart of the Oceans
Summary: Two-thirds of the Earth are covered by water. As of today\ most of the oceans have not been explored. GEBCO aims to provide the most authoritative\ publicly available bathymetry data sets for the world’s oceans

Title: How a Fleet of Wind-Powered Ocean Drones Is Changing Our Understanding of the Oceans
Summary: Our oceans are unexplored and undersampled -- today\ we still know more about other planets than our own. How can we get to a better understanding of this vast\ important ecosystem? Explorer Sebastien de Halleux shares how a new fleet of wind- and solar-powered drones is collecting data at sea in unprecedented detail\ revealing insights into things like global weather and the health of our fish stocks

Title: How close are we to completely mapping the ocean?
Summary: We’ve mapped other planets to more detail than we have our own oceans. How close are we to a complete ocean map?

Title: How underwater drones are changing our understanding of the oceans
Summary: Research oceanographer Jules Jaffe is building underwater drones that are changing our understanding of the oceans. From MAE's\ drones and swarms; find out how this technology and the "maker generation" are revolutionising the future of underwater exploration.

Title: Integrated Ocean Observing System
Summary: IOOS is our eyes on the ocean\ coasts\ and Great Lakes. We are an integrated network of people and technology gathering observing data and developing tracking and predictive tools to benefit the economy\ the environment\ and public safety at home\ across the nation\ and around the globe.

Title: Jason 3 - studying the oceans from space
Summary: To provide scientists with essential information about global and regional changes in the seas\ NASA will launch the Jason-3 satellite from Vandenberg Air Force Base in California.

Title: Monitoring the marine environment from the space
Summary: Satellite technology supports the observation and analysis of marine bio-geo-chemical processes at global and regional scale.

Title: Monitoring the oceans from space
Summary: It is important to know what our oceans are doing and the role they play in the Earth system as a whole. The analysis of remote-sensing data makes it possible to understand the oceans in new and exciting ways. This course will provide you with an overview of the different types of data\ imagery and their applications and will introduce you to the fundamental techniques and methodologies of working with this data.

Title: NASA | The Ocean: A Driving Force for Weather and Climate
Summary: This animation uses Earth science data from a variety of sensors on NASA Earth observing satellites to measure physical oceanography parameters such as ocean currents\ ocean winds\ sea surface height and sea surface temperature. These measurements\ in combination with atmospheric measurements such as surface air temperature\ precipitation and clouds can help scientists understand the ocean's impact on weather and climate and what this means for life here on Earth. NASA satellites and their unique view from space are helping to unveil the vast... and largely unexplored.... OCEAN.

Title: NASA Perpetual Ocean
Summary: This visualization shows ocean surface currents around the world during the period from June 2005 through Decemeber 2007.

Title: New Deep-Sea Robot Will Help Us Explore Oceans Throughout the Solar System
Ocean drones for a quantified planet
See a New Robot That Captures Sea Creatures—Gently
Why study the oceans from space?
Why We Know More About the Moon Than the Depths of the Ocean
Your future tech may rely on deep-sea mining
Agreement establishing the Caribbean Community Common Fisheries Policy
Summary: Agreement establishing the Caribbean Community Common Fisheries Policy

Title: Belize ICZM Plan
Summary: Belize is home to the planet's second longest unbroken reef system and its coastal zone contains a rich diversity of habitats and attractions\ including three atolls\ several coastal lagoons\ mangrove forests\ and over 300 cayes. The goal of the ICZM Plan is to recommend actions that will ensure sustainable coastal resources use by balancing conservation ideals with the economic and social needs of the country.

Title: Capture Fisheries
Summary: This third volume in the Commonwealth Blue Economy series explores the potential for the further development of capture fisheries as a key contributing sector to the blue economy for SIDS.

Title: Caribbean Community Common Fisheries Policy
Summary: The Caribbean Community Common Fisheries Policy (CCCFP) is a binding treaty focusing on cooperation and collaboration of Caribbean people\ fishermen and governments in conserving\ managing and sustainably utilising fisheries and related ecosystems.

Title: Caribbean Fisheries Management Council
Summary: Conserving\ Restoring and Managing of Fishery Resources in the US Caribbean

Title: Communicaton of marine spatial planning
Summary: How to communicate effectively within the complex MSP process

Title: Developments in international ocean governance
Summary: IMarEST TV recording of the 8 March 2019 lecture presented by Lowri Mai Griffiths\ Maritime Policy Unit at the UK's Foreign and Commonwealth Office\ to the Ocean Governance Special Interest Group held at IMarEST HQ.

Title: European MSP Platform
Summary: The European MSP Platform is an information and communication gateway designed to offer support to all EU Member States in their efforts to implement Maritime Spatial Planning (MSP) in the years to come.

Title: Evaluating Marine Spatial Planning
Summary: how do you know if these planning processes are working? Considerable resources are being allocated to marine planning\ implementation\ and enforcement throughout the world\ but will the results of these plans be effective\ will the benefits of these new marine management programs be worth the costs? Who will bear the costs of the plans? Who will benefit? How will you know what works and what doesn’t?

Title: Fisheries Economics and Policy: Intro to Fisheries Management
Summary: This series is for individuals who want to learn - or review - the basic economics of conservation.  This video introduces the concept of how a population of fish can be managed sustainably.

Title: Global fisheries statistics
Summary: The FAO Fisheries and Aquaculture Department provides advice and objective information to Members to help promote responsible aquaculture and fisheries. To fulfil this role\ the Department compiles\ analyses and disseminates fishery and aquaculture data\ structured within data collections.

Title: Implementing and Monitoring the Sustainable Development Goals in the Caribbean: The Role of the Ocean
Summary: Identifying and Articulating Knowledge Needs for the Implementation and Monitoring of the Sustainable Development Goals in Caribbean Small Island States and Matching Those Needs to Knowledge\ Tools\ and Data.

Title: International ocean governance
Summary: IUCN's work on ocean governance covers many of the issues relating to the sustainable use and management of coastal\ transboundary and international waters from large marine ecosystems to the high seas.

Title: International ocean governance: an agenda for the future of our oceans
Summary: The 50 actions for safe\ secure\ clean and sustainably managed oceans in Europe and around the world are all successfully being implemented\ while on a number of them the work will continue.

Title: Law of the Sea
Summary: Lecture series from the UN Office of Legal Affairs on the law of the sea

Title: Marine Spatial Planning
Summary: Marine spatial planning is about engaging with people to plan for the future. New approaches to address conflicting uses\ identify values\ and achieve national conservation goals are emerging based on practical experience\ research\ local knowledge and innovation\ and urgency for change.

Title: Marine Spatial Planning in a nutshell
Summary: “Marine Spatial Planning – in a nutshell” is a five-minute film that explains MSP simply and dynamically. It is suitable for everyone: from local communities to planners and policy-makers.

Title: Marine Spatial Planning\ a step by step approach
Summary: This  UNESCO  publication  on  MSP  provides a step-by-step approach to MSP from establishing authority\ through planning to implementa-tion\ monitoring and evaluation.

Title: Maritime Spatial Planning
Summary: What is MSP in the EU\ what benefits does it bring\ and how does the EU support MSP?

Title: MSP around the globe
Summary: Over the past 15 years\ marine spatial planning (MSP) has gained considerable importance all around the world. This website provides a summary of global MSP initiatives

Climate Change Ocean Facts
Summary: Global ocean data and trends for informed action and decision-making on climate change

Title: Climate Change Report Author Explains Why Oceans Are At Risk
Summary: The Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change has released an alarming report on how climate change is impacting the oceans\ ice caps and our way of life.

Title: Climate change will shift the oceans’ colors
Summary: In the next century\ satellites will watch as the ocean's blues and greens intensify.

Title: High Level Ocean and Climate Conference Bulletin
Summary: Briefing on the The High Level Scientific Conference “From COP21 towards the United Nations Decade of Ocean Science for Sustainable Development (2021-2030)” September 2018

Title: How does climate change affect coral reefs
Summary: The varied effects of climate change are changing the ocean; these changes dramatically affect coral reef ecosystems.

Title: How will climate change impact ocean health
Summary: The oceans provide one-quarter of the world’s dietary protein\ yet we have little understanding of how changes in ocean temperatures and chemistry will impact ocean life—from microbes to coral reefs to commercial fish stocks—and threaten food security.

Title: Impacts of climate change on the ocean
Summary: The marine environment is already registering the impacts of climate change. The current increase in global temperature of 0.7°C since pre-industrial times is disrupting life in the oceans\ from the tropics to the poles.

Title: Impacts of Climate Change on Tourism in the Coastal and Marine Environments of Caribbean Small Island Developing States
Summary: Climate change is already having a negative impact on the tourism sector in the Caribbean\ with temperature increases causing coral bleaching and an increase in the frequency of droughts which affects the availability of water

Title: Marine protected areas and climate change
Summary: MPAs not only maintain vital ecosystems\ they contribute to reducing atmospheric concentrations of greenhouse gases. Maintaining these services can only be achieved by increasing the number of MPAs and their integration into broader climate action frameworks.

Title: Ocean Acidification and Other Ocean Climate Changes
Summary: The world’s oceans have absorbed about 93% of the excess heat caused by greenhouse gas warming since the mid-20th century\ making them warmer and altering global and regional climate feedbacks.

Title: Ocean acidification the evil twin of climate change
Summary: In this talk\ Dr. Triona McGrath explains how our oceans are changing due to increasing levels of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere and how it will impact our marine life. Triona shares her thoughts on ocean acidification and explain why it is the evil twin of climate change.

Title: Ocean species are disappearing faster than those on land
Summary: Climate change is being more keenly felt by the sea's cold-blooded creatures.

Title: Oceans and ice are absorbing the brunt of climate change
Summary: The latest report from the IPCC highlights the dramatic toll warming has taken on the world's water

Title: Oceans of climate change
Summary: Oceanographer Josh Willis discusses the heat capacity of water\ performs an experiment to demonstrate heat capacity using a water balloon and describes how water's ability to store heat affects Earth's climate.

Title: Seaweed 'forests' can help fight climate change
Summary: Farming seaweed\ then sinking the mature plants to the bottom of the ocean\ could be an effective way to fight warming. So why don’t we do it?

Title: The Climate Change Connection
Summary: Our climate is steadily getting warmer. We are starting to see the effects of climate change now. But\ there are ways to reduce climate change and lessen these harmful consequences. If we all work together\ we can make a difference to reduce climate change.

Title: The End of the Line\ where have all the fish gone?
Summary: The End of the Line is the world’s first major feature documentary about the devastating impact overfishing has had and is having on our oceans. The film provides a dramatic expose of those in power who are taking advantage of the seas with catastrophic consequences on the world’s fish supplies

Title: The ocean and climate change
Summary: At the front line of climate change\ the ocean\ the coastlines and coastal communities are being disproportionately impacted by increasing carbon dioxide (CO2) and other greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions from human activities.

Title: The ocean and cryosphere in a changin environment
Summary: This Special Report on the Ocean and Cryosphere in a Changing Climate (SROCC)  is structured in three parts: A: Observed changes and impacts\ B: Projected changes and risks\ and C: Implementing Responses to Ocean and Cryosphere Change.

Title: Troubled Waters\ the impacts of overfishing
Summary: Troubled Waters explores what has happened to our oceans because of our appetite for seafood\ and looks what we can do personally to kick start a reformed fishing industry.

Title: UK Marine Climate Change Impacts Partnership
Summary: The United Kingdom Marine Climate Change Impacts Partnership (MCCIP) brings together scientists\ government\ its agencies and NGOs to provide co-ordinated advice on climate change impacts and adaptation around our coast and in our seas.

Title: Will the ocean ever run out of fish
Summary: When most people think of fishing\ we imagine relaxing in a boat and patiently reeling in the day’s catch. But modern industrial fishing -- the kind that stocks our grocery shelves -- looks more like warfare. Ayana Elizabeth Johnson and Jennifer Jacquet explain overfishing and its effects on ecosystems\ food security\ jobs\ economies\ and coastal cultures.

Title: A journey to Planet Ocean
Summary: Scientist and diver Pierre-Yves Cousteau shares his passion and his love: the Oceans of this world and their amazing beauty.

Title: Deep-sea mining: vital resource or environmental disaster?
Summary: Surging demand for the metals used in electric car batteries is setting off a race to mine the deep seas. As the FT’s Henry Sanderson explains\ the sea floor could contain more nickel\ cobalt and rare earth metals than all land-based reserves combined. Miners say it may diversify supply\ but environmentalists fear mining will do irreparable damage.

Title: Do we know enough about the deep sea to mine it?
Summary: Eighteen years of company-collected data on deep sea ecosystems targeted for mining will add to our scant knowledge of the abyss

Title: How we wrecked the ocean
Summary: coral reef ecologist Jeremy Jackson lays out the shocking state of the ocean today: overfished\ overheated\ polluted\ with indicators that things will get much worse. Astonishing photos and stats make the case.

Title: Know\ Feel\ Act to Stop Marine Litter
Summary: the educational material “Know Feel Act! To Stop Marine Litter” has been prepared to inform\ sensitise and enable European teachers and students to take action to tackle the problem of litter in our seas and coasts.

Title: Marine litter
Summary: A lot of our trash ends up in the ocean - even trash discarded far upstream. Marine litter can travel hundreds of miles via rivers and waterways to even the most remote parts of the planet. It causes billions of dollars in damage\ is a threat to sea life and even to human health.

Title: marine pollution
Summary: A staggering amount of waste - much of which has only existed for the past 60 years or so - enters the oceans each year.

‘The ocean and us’ - BBC Earth\ United Nations Ocean Conference
Summary: Our ocean defines our planet.It sustains us… and it is home to more than half of all life on earth today

Title: A teachers guide to marine environmental education in Saint Lucia
Summary: This Guide to Marine Environmental Education is aimed at providing some direction to teachers in communicating the importance of marine resources management in the classroom.

Title: Ask a fisherman\ Maldives
Summary: Video showing the views of fishermen in the Maldives

Title: Blue Gym
Summary: Acknowledging the importance of the sea’s influence on our mental and physical health\ the Blue Gym concept refers to using the coastal environment specifically to promote health and wellbeing by increasing physical activity\ reducing stress and building stronger communities.

Title: BlueHealth2020
Summary: BlueHealth is a pan-European research initiative investigating the links between environment\ climate and health. The programme is specifically focused on understanding how water-based environments in towns and cities can affect health and wellbeing.

Title: Community based fisheries management in Solomon Islands
Summary: More than 80% of Solomon Islanders live in coastal communities\ where fisheries and marine resources are critical sources of food\ nutrition and income. To replenish dwindling fish stocks and ensure plentiful supplies for future generations\ communities are developing fisheries management plans to control the use of marine resources.

Title: Community-based Fisheries Management - Fishing voices from the Pacific
Summary: With the support of fisheries agencies\ community-based fisheries management efforts in Fiji\ Samoa and Tonga empowers these coastal fishing communities to take control of marine resources that ensure their food security and livelihoods.  And importantly\ it protects the environment as well as preserves the social\ cultural and traditions of Pacific island people.

Title: Human health and the ocean
Summary: This video illustrates the links between human health and the ocean by highlighting 5 ways in which the ocean affects our health and wellbeing. These links include climate regulation\ food\ pollution\ medicine and the blue gym effect.

Title: Island Communities cultivate ocean stewardship
Summary: Today\ island communities\ especially those in the Pacific Ocean\ are combining traditional knowledge with science to develop innovative strategies to protect the ocean while bolstering local livelihoods and maintaining age-old practices.

Title: Linking oceans\ human health and wellbeing
Summary: Interactions between marine environments and human health are highly complex and can be classified both in terms of risks and benefits which need to be better understood.

Title: Make a sea change eating on the go
Summary: Avoiding single use plastic reduces waste that can enter the marine environment

Summary: Small changes that can be made in the bathroom to protect our marine environment

Summary: Small changes that can be made in the office to protect our marine environment

Summary: In Australia\ Latin American and the Caribbean (including the United States)\ marine outfalls are used to dispose of wastewater. We are seeing that the ocean can not absorb the pollution that we put into it

Title: Belize ICZM
Summary: Belize is home to the planet's second longest unbroken reef system and its coastal zone contains a rich diversity of habitats and attractions\ including three atolls\ several coastal lagoons\ mangrove forests\ and over 300 cayes. The goal of the ICZM Plan is to recommend actions that will ensure sustainable coastal resources use by balancing conservation ideals with the economic and social needs of the country.

Title: Blue Tourism – The Transition Towards Sustainable Coastal and Maritime Tourism in World Marine Regions
Summary: This report intends to understand and define the ecological impacts of coastal and marine tourism

Title: Coastal and Maritime Tourism
Summary: Sector overview of coastal and maritime tourism in the EU

Title: Green Fins: Improving sustainability in the marine tourism sector
Summary: Originally established in Thailand in 2004\ the Green Fins approach\ a tool for supporting adoption and implementation of best practices in the diving and snorkeling tourism industry\ is now active in six countries in Asia and is currently being expanded to other regions.

Title: Integrated coastal management
Summary: Integrated coastal management aims for the coordinated application of the different policies affecting the coastal zone and related to activities such as nature protection\ aquaculture\ fisheries\ agriculture\ industry\ off shore wind energy\ shipping\ tourism\ development of infrastructure and mitigation and adaptation to climate change.

Title: Sandy Island/Oyster Bed Marine Protected Area Moorings Restoration Project
Summary: We visited the Sandy Island/Oyster Bed Marine Protected Area to document the installation of new moorings

Title: Sustainable Marine Tourism in the Coral Triangle

UN: fostering sustainable coastal and marine tourism in the Caribbean
Areas Beyond National Jurisdiction
Summary: Marine Areas Beyond National Jurisdiction (ABNJ)\ commonly called the high seas\ are those areas of ocean for which no one nation has sole responsibility for management. In all\ these make up 40 percent of the surface of our planet\ comprising 64 percent of the surface of the oceans and nearly 95 percent of its volume.

Title: Common Oceans - A partnership for sustainability in the ABNJ
Summary: FAO resources on areas beyond national jurisdiction

Title: First ever high-seas conservation treaty would protect life in international waters
Summary: No flag can claim the high seas\ but many nations exploit them. Now\ nations are negotiating the first-ever high-seas conservation treaty

Title: Governing areas beyond national jurisdiction
Summary: Nearly two-thirds of the world’s ocean is beyond national jurisdiction – where no single state has authority. This area reaches depths of over 10 km and represents 95% of the Earth’s total habitat by volume.

Title: he Areas Beyond National Jurisdiction Program
Summary: The Areas Beyond National Jurisdiction Program (ABNJ) -- often referred to as Common Oceans -- is a broad-scale\ innovative approach to achieve efficient and sustainable management of fisheries resources and biodiversity conservation in marine areas that do not fall under the responsibility of any one country.

Title: High seas alliance
Summary: Since its founding in 2011\ the High Seas Alliance (HSA) with its 37+ non-governmental members and the International Union for Conservation of Nature has been working towards protecting the 50% of the planet that is the high seas.

Title: High seas protection
Summary: marine conservation biologist Professor Callum Roberts talks about his work with scientists and NGOs to map out a network of anctuaries for the high seas which are required to save the world’s oceans\ protect wildlife and fight climate breakdown.

Title: How to save the high seas
Summary: As the United Nations prepares a historic treaty to protect the oceans\ scientists highlight what’s needed for success.

Title: Our Oceans’ Last Chance: Protect the High Seas
Summary: The open ocean\ called the high seas\ lies outside the boundaries of any country\ making up nearly two-thirds of our ocean and providing 90 percent of the habitat for all ocean life. But only about half of 1 percent of the high seas are fully protected from fishing\ mining\ and other human activity.

Title: The High Seas Need Protection Now
The High Seas: UN Has One Chance To Get This Right
WEBINAR: Data For Areas Beyond National Jurisdiction
WEBINAR: Tools For Areas Beyond National Jurisdiction
What Are the High Seas? Why Do They Need Help?

500 years of ocean change
Summary: This visual\ based on scientific data\ shows how the ocean has evolved in terms of temperature\ acidity\ sea-level\ ice-cover\ plastic pollution\ shipping\ stocks of larger animals\ etc. in the past 500 years.

Title: Creatures in the deepest trenches of the sea are eating plastic
Summary: In six of the ocean's deepest crevasses\ scientists found tiny shrimp-like creatures chomping on tiny bits of plastic.

Title: Creatures of the deep
Summary: About 60 percent of the ocean is a cold\ dark region that spans down to 11\000 meters. This zone is known as the deep ocean\ and though it seems like an inhospitable and remote corner of the planet\ it is actually one of the greatest habitats on Earth. Lidia Lins explores how so many species thrive in this mysterious underwater world.

Title: Deep ocean is the last frontier
Summary: The ocean covers 70% of our planet. The deep-sea floor is a realm that is largely unexplored\ but cutting-edge technology is enabling a new generation of aquanauts to go deeper than ever before.

Title: Deep ocean mysteries and wonders
Summary: In the deepest\ darkest parts of the oceans are ecosystems with more diversity than a tropical rainforest. Taking us on a voyage into the ocean -- from the deepest trenches to the remains of Titanic -- marine biologist David Gallo explores the wonder and beauty of marine life.

Title: Deep sea ecoystems
Summary: FAO briefing on deep sea ecosystems

Title: Deep sea wonders of the Caribbean -  exploring the deep wilderness
Summary: an introduction to deep-sea exploration in the Caribbean

Title: Deep sea wonders of the Caribbean - an ocean of opportunity
Summary: careers of the deep sea

Title: Deep sea wonders of the Caribbean - beyond the beaches
Summary: The Caribbean’s deep-sea environment and how organisms there have adapted

Title: Deep sea wonders of the Caribbean - hot sun cold seeps
Summary: a unique look into Trinidad and Tobago’s deep ocean

Title: Deep sea wonders of the Caribbean- the jenny that kicks
Summary: a unique look into Grenada’s deep ocean

Title: Diving down to the deep ocean
Summary: Even in the perpetual darkness of the deepest ocean\ scientists discover the discarded rubbish of modern life.

Title: El Nino and La Nina explained
Summary: Understanding two of the largest global ocean phenomenons and how this effects global weather

Title: Exploring the Mariana Trench
Summary: Explore the The Deepest & Most Unexplored Place On The Planet

Title: How a grain of sand rewrote our ocean's history
Summary: Andrew Wheeler and his team use ROVs to collect core samples from the deep ocean\ their layers revealing Earth's geological history. Andrew tells the story a grain of sand taken from the deep ocean\ and how it has changed our understanding of how Ireland's landscape was shaped two million years ago.

Title: How big is the ocean
Summary: While the Earth's oceans are known as five separate entities\ there is really only one ocean. So\ how big is it? As of 2013\ it takes up 71% of the Earth\ houses 99% of the biosphere\ and contains some of Earth's grandest geological features. Scott Gass reminds us of the influence humans have on the ocean and the influence it has on us

Title: How do ocean currents work
Summary: In 1992\ a cargo ship carrying bath toys got caught in a storm. Shipping containers washed overboard\ and the waves swept 28\000 rubber ducks and other toys into the North Pacific. But they didn't stick together -- the ducks have since washed up all over the world. How did this happen? Jennifer Verduin dives into the science of ocean currents.

Title: How do tides work
Summary: Most people are already familiar with the idea of high and low tides\ but where do they come from? What causes this movement and why does it occur with such regularity?

Title: How life begins in the deep ocean
Summary: Where do squid\ jellyfish and other sea creatures begin life? The story of a sea urchin reveals a stunningly beautiful saga of fertilization\ development and growth in the ocean depths.

Title: Just how deep does the ocean go?
Knowledge gaps in understanding the ocean
Mountains hidden in the deep sea are biological hot spots. Will mining ruin them?
Where did earth's water come from?
